intro: Wigandia scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpion plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its unique appearance.
